Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Summary


	We are looking for a Finance Officer to join our vibrant team at Pulse Nigeria.
	In this role, you will be at the heart of our financial operations managing invoices, payments, reconciliations and reporting while working closely with sales and other departments to drive accuracy, compliance and efficiency.
	This is a great opportunity to sharpen your skills, take ownership of key financial processes and make a direct impact on achieving our business goals.

	Support the management of account receivables

	Ensure the correct recording of COGS from all Ad Managers and realize corresponding revenue in real time
	Compute monthly commissions, variable salaries and bonuses for the Sales department and other Executives
	Ensures all invoices, purchase orders, tax certificates, contracts and other relevant documentation are compliant according to local tax regulations and uploaded / referenced in the ERP and Finance Google Drive

	Support the Sales and Finance department in all activities that can help the company to meet revenue and profit targets
	Maintain strong, trusting relationships with all internal collaborators and external stakeholders
	Perform other duties as may be assigned by your team lead

	Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working across teams.
	Professional certification or progress towards one (ICAN, ACCA) will be an added advantage.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.

Finance Officer Job at Pulse Nigeria




        
    

        
        Pulse is Africa’s leading innovative media company, informing and engaging Africa’s young audience - and providing expansive media reach and creative marketing solutions to partners. We run news websites and social channels and marketing and production across Francophone and Anglophone West Africa and East Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Officer

Job Location: Maryland, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	We are looking for a Finance Officer to join our vibrant team at Pulse Nigeria.
	In this role, you will be at the heart of our financial operations managing invoices, payments, reconciliations and reporting while working closely with sales and other departments to drive accuracy, compliance and efficiency.
	This is a great opportunity to sharpen your skills, take ownership of key financial processes and make a direct impact on achieving our business goals.


Responsibilities


	Generating, booking and clearing of invoices accurately for customers using the ERP
	Ensure timely and accurate booking and realization of revenues
	Daily posting of transactions into the GL
	Support the management of account receivables
	Handling supplier payments and management of account payables
	Reconciliation of client account statements working closely with the Sales department
	Handling tax reconciliation, payment and filling
	Ensure the correct recording of COGS from all Ad Managers and realize corresponding revenue in real time
	Compute monthly commissions, variable salaries and bonuses for the Sales department and other Executives
	Ensures all invoices, purchase orders, tax certificates, contracts and other relevant documentation are compliant according to local tax regulations and uploaded / referenced in the ERP and Finance Google Drive
	Support with month closing, ensuring Finance department deadlines are met
	Support with sales, finance and business intelligence analysis and reporting
	Work with the Sales and other departments to ensure compliance with business processes
	Support in all efforts for timely funds recovery and to minimise bad debt risk
	Ensure a high-level of accuracy, regulatory compliance, initiative and timeliness in performing all tasks
	Actively identify and propose improved processes that can have a positive impact and help to achieve business goals
	Stay up to date with relevant regulatory guidelines and industry best practice and ensure utmost compliance.
	Support the Sales and Finance department in all activities that can help the company to meet revenue and profit targets
	Maintain strong, trusting relationships with all internal collaborators and external stakeholders
	Perform other duties as may be assigned by your team lead
	Ensure all activities align with the company Code of Conduct.


Requirements


	Must be a graduate of Accounting (B.Sc./HND).
	2 - 3 years of proven experience in accounting operations, preferably within a structured organization.
	Familiarity with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, or any ERP system).
	Must possess advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
	Strong understanding of financial reporting and general ledger management.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to details.
	Ability to manage multiple tasks and deadlines effectively.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills for working across teams.
	Professional certification or progress towards one (ICAN, ACCA) will be an added advantage.


Benefits


	Flexible Hybrid Work Model
	Health Insurance Cover
	Group Life Insurance
	Contributory Pension Scheme
	Annual Bonuses
	Telecommunication Allowance.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Business Development Officer",
  "description": "Prestigious Consulting is a professional HR consultancy firm. We focus on improving organizational performance through strategic people &amp; process management.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Fola Osibo, Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Identify and develop new business opportunities with hospitals, HMOs, corporate organizations, and referral partners.
	Develop proposals, presentations, and partnership models to attract and retain clients.
	Collaborate with the marketing team to create strategies that boost service awareness and increase patient volume.
	Conduct market research to stay updated on healthcare and diagnostic industry trends.
	Maintain strong relationships with existing clients to encourage repeat business.
	Achieve revenue and business growth targets set by management.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Tax Specialist",
  "description": "PalmPay is an Africa-focused fintech firm, launched in 2019. PalmPay is a mobile payments platform that offers a number of financial services.

Applications are invited from suitably qualified candidates for the position below:

Job Poition: Tax Specialist

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job&nbsp;Responsibilities
Tax&nbsp;Compliance&nbsp;and&nbsp;Reporting:


	Accurately&nbsp;calculate&nbsp;and&nbsp;file&nbsp;monthly/quarterly/annual&nbsp;taxes&nbsp;in&nbsp;strict&nbsp;accordance&nbsp;with&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;tax&nbsp;laws,&nbsp;including&nbsp;but&nbsp;not&nbsp;limited&nbsp;to&nbsp;Value&nbsp;Added&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;(VAT),&nbsp;Corporate&nbsp;Income&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;(CIT),&nbsp;Withholding&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;(WHT),&nbsp;etc.,&nbsp;ensuring&nbsp;100%&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;with&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;tax&nbsp;laws&nbsp;and&nbsp;regulations.
	Manage&nbsp;the&nbsp;full&nbsp;cycle&nbsp;of&nbsp;tax&nbsp;filings,&nbsp;including&nbsp;data&nbsp;collection,&nbsp;reconciliation,&nbsp;declaration&nbsp;submission&nbsp;via&nbsp;FIRS&nbsp;e-filing&nbsp;systems,&nbsp;and&nbsp;timely&nbsp;tax&nbsp;payment.
	Maintain&nbsp;meticulous&nbsp;records&nbsp;of&nbsp;tax-related&nbsp;documents&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;tax&nbsp;returns,&nbsp;payment&nbsp;receipts,&nbsp;invoices)&nbsp;and&nbsp;ensure&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;with&nbsp;document&nbsp;retention&nbsp;requirements&nbsp;for&nbsp;FIRS/SBIR&nbsp;audits.


Financial&nbsp;Reporting&nbsp;and&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;Accounting:


	Prepare&nbsp;monthly&nbsp;tax&nbsp;provisions&nbsp;and&nbsp;ensure&nbsp;accurate&nbsp;recording&nbsp;of&nbsp;tax&nbsp;transactions&nbsp;in&nbsp;the&nbsp;general&nbsp;ledger&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;debits/credits&nbsp;for&nbsp;VAT&nbsp;payable,&nbsp;PAYE&nbsp;accruals).
	Reconcile&nbsp;tax&nbsp;balances&nbsp;with&nbsp;financial&nbsp;statements&nbsp;to&nbsp;maintain&nbsp;data&nbsp;integrity.
	Support&nbsp;the&nbsp;calculation&nbsp;of&nbsp;deferred&nbsp;tax&nbsp;assets&nbsp;(DTA)&nbsp;and&nbsp;liabilities&nbsp;(DTL)&nbsp;in&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;with&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;Accounting&nbsp;Standards&nbsp;(NAS)&nbsp;or&nbsp;IFRS.


Transaction&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;Management:


	Oversee&nbsp;end-to&nbsp; end&nbsp;invoice&nbsp;operations,ensure&nbsp;invoices&nbsp;align&nbsp;with&nbsp;VAT&nbsp;regulations&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;accurate&nbsp;customer&nbsp;details,&nbsp;tax&nbsp;rates,&nbsp;and&nbsp;transaction&nbsp;classifications).
	Regularly&nbsp;audit&nbsp;transaction&nbsp;records&nbsp;in&nbsp;the&nbsp;EKB&nbsp;system&nbsp;to&nbsp;validate&nbsp;tax&nbsp;classification&nbsp;accuracy&nbsp;and&nbsp;correct&nbsp;any&nbsp;discrepancies&nbsp;in&nbsp;tax&nbsp;rate&nbsp;application.
	Review&nbsp;business&nbsp;contracts&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;payment&nbsp;agreements,&nbsp;partnerships)&nbsp;to&nbsp;identify&nbsp;potential&nbsp;tax&nbsp;risks&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;withholding&nbsp;tax&nbsp;obligations,&nbsp;crossborder&nbsp;tax&nbsp;implications)&nbsp;and&nbsp;provide&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;recommendations.


Tax&nbsp;Risk&nbsp;Management&nbsp;and&nbsp;Audit&nbsp;Support:


	Monitor&nbsp;changes&nbsp;in&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;tax&nbsp;policies&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;Finance&nbsp;Act&nbsp;updates,&nbsp;FIRS&nbsp;circulars)&nbsp;and&nbsp;assess&nbsp;their&nbsp;impact&nbsp;on&nbsp;the&nbsp;company&rsquo;s&nbsp;operations.&nbsp;Proactively&nbsp;advise&nbsp;teams&nbsp;on&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;adjustments.
	Assist&nbsp;the&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;Manager&nbsp;in&nbsp;responding&nbsp;to&nbsp;tax&nbsp;authority&nbsp;inquiries&nbsp;(FIRS/SBIR&nbsp;audits),&nbsp;preparing&nbsp;supporting&nbsp;documents,&nbsp;and&nbsp;coordinating&nbsp;with&nbsp;external&nbsp;advisors&nbsp;to&nbsp;resolve&nbsp;disputes.


Key&nbsp;Qualifications&nbsp;for&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;Specialist&nbsp;Position
Education&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Certification:


	Bachelor&rsquo;s&nbsp;degree&nbsp;in&nbsp;Accounting,&nbsp;Taxation,&nbsp;Finance,&nbsp;or&nbsp;related&nbsp;field.
	Professional&nbsp;certification&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;ICAN,&nbsp;ACCA,&nbsp;CITN)&nbsp;is&nbsp;strongly&nbsp;preferred.


Work&nbsp;Experience:


	Minimum&nbsp;3&nbsp;years&nbsp;of&nbsp;hands&nbsp;-&nbsp;on&nbsp;experience&nbsp;in&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;tax&nbsp;accounting,&nbsp;compliance,&nbsp;and&nbsp;reporting.
	Financial&nbsp;services&nbsp;or&nbsp;fintech&nbsp;industry&nbsp;experience,&nbsp;knowledge&nbsp;of&nbsp;Nigerian&nbsp;payment&nbsp;systems&nbsp;(e.g.,&nbsp;NIBSS,&nbsp;Paystack,&nbsp;Flutterwave)&nbsp;and&nbsp;their&nbsp;tax&nbsp;implications&nbsp;are&nbsp;highly&nbsp;desirable..
	Experience&nbsp;working&nbsp;with&nbsp;multinational&nbsp;corporations&nbsp;or&nbsp;Big&nbsp;4&nbsp;accounting&nbsp;firms&nbsp;preferred.


Core&nbsp;Competencies:


	Attention&nbsp;to&nbsp;detail&nbsp;and&nbsp;accuracy&nbsp;in&nbsp;handling&nbsp;complex&nbsp;tax&nbsp;calculations&nbsp;and&nbsp;filings.
	Analytical&nbsp;skills&nbsp;to&nbsp;interpret&nbsp;tax&nbsp;regulations&nbsp;and&nbsp;assess&nbsp;business&nbsp;impacts.
	Problem&nbsp;-&nbsp;solving&nbsp;abilities&nbsp;to&nbsp;address&nbsp;tax&nbsp;compliance&nbsp;issues&nbsp;and&nbsp;optimize&nbsp;tax&nbsp;positions.
	Communication&nbsp;skills&nbsp;to&nbsp;liaise&nbsp;effectively&nbsp;with&nbsp;internal&nbsp;teams,&nbsp;tax&nbsp;authorities&nbsp;(FIRS/SBIR),&nbsp;and&nbsp;external&nbsp;advisors.
	Team&nbsp;player&nbsp;with&nbsp;the&nbsp;ability&nbsp;to&nbsp;collaborate&nbsp;cross&nbsp;-&nbsp;functionally&nbsp;in&nbsp;a&nbsp;fast&nbsp;-&nbsp;paced&nbsp;environment.
	Adaptability&nbsp;to&nbsp;changing&nbsp;tax&nbsp;policies&nbsp;and&nbsp;regulations.
	Adequate&nbsp;knowledge&nbsp;of&nbsp;tax&nbsp;authorities&nbsp;softwares&nbsp;such&nbsp;as&nbsp;Tax&nbsp;ProMax,&nbsp;e-Tax&nbsp;Portal&nbsp;and&nbsp;others.
